OrgName.entry: SHEFFIELD HEALTH AND SOCIAL CARE TRUST, SUBSTANCE MISUSE SERVICE

Desc.entry:
Substance Misuse Services helps Sheffield residents aged 18 years and over irrespective of the type of substance use, to engage in clinical treatment interventions.
Acts as the single entry point for access and referral, and open the door to treatment services for drug and alcohol misuse in Sheffield. A city-wide service linking into all hospitals, community mental health teams, prisons and rehabilitation placements. The service operates in the community and within hospital settings and has five dedicated beds for inpatient admission for detoxification.
Offers 4 different services:  Substance Misuse  Drugs (professional referral required) A range of treatment options are offered once a comprehensive assessment has been completed. This is complemented with an engagement and retention plan in treatment.  Substance Misuse  Harm Reduction The aim of the service is to set up local clinics to provide screening, vaccination and wound care to reduce the physical harm from injecting drug misuse.  Substance Misuse  Alcohol (professional referral required) Provides packages of care to assist in reducing alcohol intake (health permitting) or to become abstinent and access to psycho-social interventions.  Substance Misuse  Open Access Alcohol (self or professional referral) Provides support, advice and information to anyone wanting to make changes to their drinking habits. We also provide advice and support to people affected by someone elses drinking.
Substance Misuse Services can help you:  By signposting to a suitable service  Manage substance use safely (harm reduction strategies)  Reduce substance use to safer limits (if health permitting)  Access alternative treatments  With support to discontinue use/become abstinent
